apidoc:summary.p: The Admin module is an XQuery library module that enables you to script administrative tasks that you otherwise would need the Admin Interface to perform. Most functions in this library perform adminstrative tasks and therefore require a user with the the Admin role.

Many of these functions provide new configuration information. In most cases, you must save the configuration (with admin:save-configuration, for example) in the same statement that you use the functions in order for them to take effect.
To use the Admin module as part of your own XQuery module, include the following line in your XQuery prolog:
The library namespace prefix admin is not predefined in the server.

apidoc:function.name: get-database-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the database IDs from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: get-host-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the host IDs from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: get-group-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the group IDs from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: get-forest-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the forest IDs from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: get-appserver-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the appserver IDs from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: get-configuration
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Loads the admin configuration into memory for use by other functions in the Admin module.
apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The configuration is loaded into memory only as it is needed, so it might not contain the entire configuration at any given moment. It loads only the parts of the configuration that are needed at the time they are needed to perform other Admin module operations that specified in the XQuery request. Therefore, if you execute the function without calling any other Admin module functions, it will return the empty sequence (because it never needed any of the config information to perform any of the Admin module operations).

apidoc:function.name: save-configuration-without-restart
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function saves a configuration specification to the cluster configuration files, without restarting MarkLogic Server. If you use this function to save any changes that require a server restart ("cold" changes such as App Server port assignment changes), then the changes will not take effect until the next time MarkLogic Server restarts (although they will be saved in the configuration). If you want MarkLogic Server to automatically restart when needed, use admin:save-configuration instead.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The return value is a list of the host IDs that need to be restarted in order for the changes to take effect.
apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin-module-write
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/xdmp-write-cluster-config-file
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/xdmp-write-cluster-config-file/{filename}

apidoc:function.name: save-configuration
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function saves a configuration specification to the cluster configuration files. It restarts MarkLogic Server for "cold" administrative tasks only (for example, for App Server port assignment changes). If you do not want those "cold" administrative tasks to automatically restart MarkLogic Server, use admin:save-configuration-without-restart instead.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin-module-write
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/xdmp-write-cluster-config-file
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/xdmp-write-cluster-config-file/{filename}

apidoc:function.name: restart-hosts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function restarts MarkLogic Server for the specified hosts.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The host ID(s) for the host(s) you want to restart. For example, xdmp:host() returns the ID for the current host.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the configuration from the specified database(s). It does not delete the configuration or data for any forests attached to the deleted database(s).

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The id(s) for the specified database(s) (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any database whose ID you pass into this function must not have any appservers targeting it when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to delete the database, make sure no appserver targets the database in a separate transaction before calling this function.

apidoc:function.name: database-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new database specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name the database to create. The name must not be used by any other database in the cluster.
The ID of the security database (for example, xdmp:database("Security") used by this database.
The ID of the schemas database (for example, xdmp:database("Schemas") used by this database.

apidoc:function.name: database-copy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new database specification with the same settings as the database with the specified ID. The new database configuration will have the specified name.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database to copy (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the new database to create.

apidoc:function.name: database-detach-forest
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function detaches the specified forest from the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: database-attach-forest
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function attaches the specified forest to the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any forest whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the forest, do so in a separate transaction before using them in this function.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-backups
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the scheduled backups for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("mydatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-weekly-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a weekly scheduled backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
How many weeks between each backup.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the scheduled backup to start.
The maximum number of backups to keep in the backup directory.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-weekly-incremental-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a weekly scheduled incremental backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the full backup is located.
How many weeks between each backup.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the scheduled incremental backup to start.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current incremental backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the incremental backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the incremental backup.
The directory in which to save the incremental backup.
Whether or not to purge journal archive after incremental backup is performed. Defaults to false
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-monthly-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a monthly scheduled backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The number of months to elapse between each backup.
The day of the month the backup will happen (between 1 and 31)
A time for the scheduled backup to start.
The maximum number of backups to keep in the backup directory.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-monthly-incremental-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a scheduled monthly incremental backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the full backup is located.
The number of months to elapse between each incremental backup.
The day of the month the incremental backup will happen (between 1 and 31).
A time for the scheduled incremental backup to start.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current incremental backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the incremental backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the incremental backup.
The directory in which to save the incremental backup.
Whether or not to purge journal archive after incremental backup is performed. Defaults to false
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-one-time-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a one-time backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The starting dateTime of the scheduled backup.
The maximum number of backups to keep in the backup directory.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-one-time-incremental-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a one-time incremental backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the full backup is located.
The starting dateTime of the scheduled incremental backup.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current incremental backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the incremental backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the incremental backup.
The directory in which to save the incremental backup.
Whether or not to purge journal archive after incremental backup is performed. Defaults to false
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds scheduled backup specifications for a database to a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("mydatabase")).
The scheduled backup specification(s), typically the result of an admin:database-one-time-backup or an admin:database-monthly-backup or an admin:database-weekly-backup call

apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup/{id}

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes scheduled backup specifications for a database from a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("mydatabase")).
The scheduled backup(s) to delete. Typically, the result of an admin:database-get-backups call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup/{id}

apidoc:function.name: database-get-merge-blackouts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the merge blackouts specification for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-recurring-merge-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a merge-blackout specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The maximum number of megabytes for a merge.
The CPU scheduler priority for merges. Must be one of normal or lower.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thusday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the merge blackout to start.
A time for the merge blackout to end.
The amount of time for the blackout to last.

apidoc:function.name: database-one-time-merge-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a one-time merge-blackout specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The maximum number of megabytes for a merge.
The CPU scheduler priority for merges. Must be one of normal or lower.
The starting dateTime of the merge blackout.
The ending dateTime of the merge blackout.
The amount of time for the blackout to last.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-merge-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a merge blackout specification for a database to a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The merge blackout specification(s), typically the result of an admin:database-one-time-merge-blackout or an admin:database-recurring-merge-blackout call

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-merge-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a merge blackout specification for a database from a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The merge blackout(s) to delete. Typically, the result of an admin:database-get-merge-blackouts call.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-fragment-roots
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the fragment roots specification for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-fragment-root
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a fragment root specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for the node.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-fragment-root
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds the specified fragment root to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A fragment root specification, typically the result of an admin:database-fragment-root call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-fragment-root
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the specified fragment root in the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A fragment root specification, typically the result of an admin:database-fragment-root call.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-fragment-parents
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the fragment parents specification for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-fragment-parent
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a fragment parent specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for the node.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-fragment-parent
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds the specified fragment parent to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A fragment parent specification, typically the result of an admin:database-fragment-parent call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-fragment-parent
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the specified fragment parent in the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A fragment parent specification, typically the result of an admin:database-fragment-parent call.

apidoc:function.name: database-range-element-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a range element index specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
The namespace URI.
The local name for the node.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.
A boolean specifying whether to maintain value postions in this index (used with co-occurrences).
An option to handle values that do not meet the range index type. Must be one of: reject,ignore.

apidoc:function.name: database-range-field-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a range field index specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI.
The name for the field.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.
A boolean specifying whether to maintain value postions in this index (used with co-occurrences).
An option to handle values that do not meet the range index type. Must be one of: reject,ignore.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-range-element-indexes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the range element indexes specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-get-range-field-indexes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the range field indexes specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-add-range-element-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a range element index to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An element range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-element-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-range-field-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a range field index to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An field range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-field-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-range-element-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a range element index for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An element range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-element-index call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Note that the index specification to delete must exist in the configuration exactly as specified, even if the specification includes multiple QNames. If you have a range index configuration that specifies multiple QNames in a single entry, then if you want to delete the index for only one of the QNames, you must first delete the range index specification with multiple QNames and then add the indexes that you do not want to delete. To see the specifications as they are stored in the configuration, use admin:database-get-range-element-index.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-range-field-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a range field index for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A field range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-field-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-all-range-field-indexes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes all the range field indexes on given fields for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A sequence of field names.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-range-element-attribute-indexes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the range element attribute indexes specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-range-element-attribute-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a range element attribute index specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
The namespace of the parent element for the attribute.
The local name of the parent element for the attribute.
The namespace URI.
The local name for the node.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/. The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.
A boolean specifying whether to maintain value postions in this index (used with co-occurrences).
An option to handle values that do not meet the range index type. Must be one of: reject,ignore.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-range-element-attribute-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a range element attribute index to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An element attribute range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-element-attribute-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-range-element-attribute-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a range element attribute index for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An element attribute range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-element-attribute-index call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Note that the index specification to delete must exist in the configuration exactly as specified, even if the specification includes multiple QNames. If you have a range index configuration that specifies multiple QNames in a single entry, then if you want to delete the index for only one of the QNames, you must first delete the range index specification with multiple QNames and then add the indexes that you do not want to delete. To see the specifications as they are stored in the configuration, use admin:database-get-range-element-attribute-index.

apidoc:function.name: database-element-word-lexicon
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an element word lexicon specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI.
The local name for the node.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/).

apidoc:function.name: database-get-element-word-lexicons
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the element word lexicons specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-add-element-word-lexicon
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds an element word lexicon to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An element word lexicon specification, typically the result of an admin:database-element-word-lexicon call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-element-word-lexicon
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes an element word lexicon for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An element word lexicon specification, typically the result of an admin:database-element-word-lexicon call.

apidoc:function.name: database-element-attribute-word-lexicon
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an element attribute word lexicon specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace of the parent element for the attribute.
The local name of the parent element for the attribute.
The namespace URI.
The local name for the node.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-element-attribute-word-lexicons
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the element attribute word lexicons specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-geospatial-element-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a geospatial element index specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI.

The coordinate system. Must be one of wgs84, wgs84/double, etrs89, etrs89/double, raw, raw/double.
A boolean specifying whether to maintain value postions in this index (used with co-occurrences).
An option to handle values that do not meet the range index type. Must be one of: reject,ignore.

apidoc:function.name: database-geospatial-region-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a geospatial region path index specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The path expression for the index. The path should return true from cts:valid-index-path.
The coordinate system. Must be one of wgs84, wgs84/double, etrs89, etrs89/double, raw, raw/double.

Specify the precision of the geohashes to use in the index. Higher numbers result in a more precise index and faster queries, at the expense of increased index size and slower ingestion speed. Value must be between 2 and 6 (inclusive) if using a single precision coordinate system; between 3 and 6 if double precision. Ignored for raw and raw/double coordinate systems.
Specify how to handle values that cannot be parsed as regions. Allowed values: "reject" or "ignore".
Measure distance and the radii of circles in the specified units. Allowed values: miles (default), km, feet, meters.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-geospatial-region-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a geospatial region path index to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A geospatial path index specification, typically the result of calling admin:database-geospatial-region-path-index.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The index is not created until you pass the modified configuration to admin:save-configuration. You can also pass the returned configuration to another Admin API function to make additional configuration changes.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-geospatial-region-path-index

The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A geospatial path index specification, typically the result of calling admin:database-geospatial-region-path-index.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The index is not removed until you pass the modified configuration to admin:save-configuration. You can also pass the modified configuration to another Admin API function to make additional configuration changes.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-range-index-optimize
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary:
This function sets the range index optimize setting for the specified database in the configuration.
When set to facet-time, range indexes are optimized to minimize the amount of CPU time used. When set to memory-size, range indexes are optimized to minimize the amount of memory used.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new range index optimize value. Must be one of facet-time or memory-size.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the directory creation setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new directory creation setting. Must be one of: automatic, manual-enforced, or manual.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-format-compatibility
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the format compatibility setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new format-compatibility setting. Must be one of: automatic, 5.0, or 4.2.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-large-size-threshold
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the threshold at which binary documents in the specified database should be handled as binary large objects (BLOBs). Binary documents less than or equal to the threshold are treated as small binary objects, stored in stands. Binary documents larger than the threshold are stored in the Large Data Directory for more efficient memory consumption.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The size in kilobytes beyond which binary documents are treated as binary large objects (BLOBs) and stored in the Large Data Directory. The default is 1 MB.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage:
Binary documents with size less than or equal to the configured threshold are treated as small binary objects and stored in stands. The entire contents of a small binary document is cached in memory. Binary documents larger than the threshold are stored in the Large Data Directory for more efficient memory usage. For details about small vs. large binaries, see "Binary Format" in the Application Developer's Guide.
The threshold value is in kilobytes and must be in the range:
32 KB <= threshold <= 512 MB on 64-bit systems
32 KB <= threshold <= 128 MB on 32-bit systems
The location of the Large Data Directory may be configured during forest creation by setting the "large data directory" property on the Forest configuration page of the Admin Interface, or by passing a large-data-directory parameter to admin:forest-create.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-locking
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the locking setting for the specified database in the configuration. When set to strict, locking enforces mutual exclusion on existing documents and on new documents. When set to fast, locking enforces mutual exclusion on existing documents but not on new documents. When set to off, locking does not enforce mutual exclusion on existing documents or on new documents.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new locking value. Must be one of strict, fast, or off.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-journaling
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the journaling setting for the specified database in the configuration. When set to strict, the journal protects against MarkLogic Server process failures, host operating system kernel failures, and host hardware failures. When set to fast, the journal protects against MarkLogic Server process failures but not against host operating system kernel failures or host hardware failures. When set to off, the journal does not protect against MarkLogic Server process failures, host operating system kernel failures, or host hardware failures.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new journaling value. Must be one of strict, fast, or off.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-journal-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the journal size setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new size, in megabytes.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the positions list max size setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-merge-min-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the merge minimum size setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new size, in number of fragments.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-merge-min-ratio
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the merge min ratio setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new ratio. Larger ratios trigger more merges.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-merge-priority
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the CPU scheduler priority for merges.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new CPU scheduler priority value. Must be one of normal or lower.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-merge-timestamp
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the merge timestamp setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

The new system timestamp after which to preserve fragments in a merge. A value of 0 indicates to keep only the latest version of fragments. A negative value indicates a timestamp relative to the time of the merge, at ten million ticks per second. For example, -6000000000 means preserve fragments deleted ten minutes before the merge.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-reindexer-throttle
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the reindexer throttle setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new setting, which must be a number between 1 and 5 (inclusive). Larger numbers mean to work harder at reindexing.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID for the specified database from the configuration. The difference between this function and xdmp:database() is that the ID from this function can come from a database that has not yet been saved (that is, from a database that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created database without the need to first save the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the database.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-locking
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the locking setting for the specified database in the configuration. When set to strict, locking enforces mutual exclusion on existing documents and on new documents. When set to fast, locking enforces mutual exclusion on existing documents but not on new documents. When set to off, locking does not enforce mutual exclusion on existing documents or on new documents.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-get-journaling
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the journaling setting for the specified database in the configuration. When set to strict, the journal protects against MarkLogic Server process failures, host operating system kernel failures, and host hardware failures. When set to fast, the journal protects against MarkLogic Server process failures but not against host operating system kernel failures or host hardware failures. When set to off, the journal does not protect against MarkLogic Server process failures, host operating system kernel failures, or host hardware failures.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-get-journal-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the journal size setting for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-included-element
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an included element specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for the node.
The query weight to use in relavance calculations.
The namespace for the attribute to constrain on. Specify an empty string if there is no attribute to constrain on or if the attribute is in no namespace.
The local name of the attribute to constrain on. Specify an empty string if there is no attribute to constrain on.
The value for the attribute to constrain on (only attributes with this value). Specify an empty string if there is no attribute to constrain on.

apidoc:function.name: database-excluded-element
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an excluded element specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for the node.
The namespace URI for the constraining attribute.
The localname for the constraining attribute.
The value for the constraing attribute.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: If the third parameter is included, the fourth and fifth must also be included. These parameters are for constraining the excluded element based on a particular attribute value.

apidoc:function.name: database-field
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a field specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the field.
A boolean value, true to start including at the root, false to not include until an included element is reached.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the word query stemmed searches setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-field-two-character-searches
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the two character searches setting for the specified field is enabled. Otherwise, it returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
The new stemmed search value. Must be one of basic, advanced, decompounding, or off. It must be equal to or greater than the database setting. The empty sequence turns this setting off for the field.

The name of the field.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() or the empty sequence to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-field-include-document-root
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the field include document root setting for the specified field in the configuration.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-field-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the field name setting for the specified field in the configuration.

The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
The new name for the field.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of the specified forest, given the forest ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. If the ID does not correspond to a valid forest ID, then an exception is thrown.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-host
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the host in which the specified forest resides.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the forest with the specified name, from the specified configuration. The difference between this function and xdmp:forest() is that the ID from this function can come from a forest that has not yet been saved (that is, from a forest that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files).

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the enabled state of the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-data-directory
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of the data directory of the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-large-data-directory
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of the large data directory of the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-failover-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the state of whether failover is enabled for the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-updates-allowed
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the state of what kinds of updates are allowed for the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-failover-hosts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the IDs of the hosts defined as failover hosts for this forest. The order in which the hosts IDs are returned is significant, with the first ID being the primary host, the second (if there is one) being the secondary, and so on.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-host
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets a forest configuration to a new host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The host ID of the new host.

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the enabled state for a forest configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-failover-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the forest failover enabled state for a forest configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-fast-data-max-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the allowable size (in megabytes) for data to be kept by a forest in its fast data directory, or 0 for no limit.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The allowable size (in megabytes) of the data to be kept by the forest in its fast-data-directory, or 0 for no limit.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The server limits the size allocated to a forest to a portion of its configured fast-data directory. This limit is normally automatically calculated from the size of the fast data directory and the number of forests using it. When this parameter is not zero, it overrides the calculated limit. Recommended values are in the range of 16384 to 32768.

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-updates-allowed
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the updates-allowed state for a forest configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

The new updates-allowed state of the forest. Must be one of all for all updates allowed, delete-only for only deletes allowed, read-only for no updates allowed and to cause updating transactions to abort immediately, flash-backup for no updates allowed and to make updating transactions retry for a time period specified in the group's retry timeout.

apidoc:function.name: forest-add-failover-host
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a failover host to the list of failover hosts for the specified forest in the specified configuration. If there are already any hosts specified, this host is added to the end of the list of failover hosts.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The host ID(s) for the host(s) you want to restart. For example, xdmp:host() returns the ID for the current host.

apidoc:function.name: forest-delete-failover-host
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the specified failover host(s) from the failover-host list in the specified configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The host ID(s) for the host(s) you want to delete. For example, xdmp:host() returns the ID for the current host.

apidoc:function.name: forest-delete
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the configuration for the specified forest from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
One or more forest ids. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specified the ID for a forest named "myForest".

If set to true, deletes the data directory as well as the configuration (Note: all documents in the forest will be permanently deleted). For public forests (forests that do not use the default data directory), if set to false, deletes only the configuration information, leaving the forest data in the data directory on disk. Configuration-only deletes are available only for public forests (forests that have a data directory specified); private forests (forests that have no data directory specified and therefore are stored in the default MarkLogic data directory) will ignore this parameter and the forest data will always be deleted.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any forest whose ID you pass into this function must not be attached to a database when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to detach the forest, do so in a separate transaction before using them in this function.

apidoc:function.name: forest-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new forest configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the forest. The must be unique for all forests in the cluster.
The ID of the host (for example, xdmp:host() for the current host.
The optional data directory of the forest. If no directory is specified, then it will be a private forest.
The optional directory where large objects are stored. If no directory is specified, then large objects will be stored in DATA_DIR/Forests/FOREST_NAME/Large.
The optional directory for the fast data directory for this forest. The fast data directory is typically located on a fast storage device, such as an SSD.

apidoc:function.name: forest-copy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new forest specification with the same settings as the forest with the specified ID. The new forest configuration will have the specified name. It copies the forest configuration, but does not copy the forest data.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The name for the new forest.
The optional data directory of the forest. If no directory is specified, then it will be a private forest.
The optional directory where large objects are stored. If no directory is specified, then large objects will be stored in DATA_DIR/Forests/FOREST_NAME/Large.
An optional directory located on a fast storage device, such as an SSD.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-backups
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the scheduled backups for the specified forest from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest (for example, xdmp:forest("myforest")).

apidoc:function.name: forest-weekly-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a weekly scheduled backup.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The how many weeks between each backup.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thusday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the scheduled backup to start.

apidoc:function.name: forest-monthly-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a monthly scheduled backup.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The number of months to elapse between each backup.
The day of the month the backup will happen (between 1 and 31)
A time for the scheduled backup to start.

apidoc:function.name: forest-one-time-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a one-time backup.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the backup will be saved to.
The starting dateTime of the scheduled backup.

apidoc:function.name: forest-add-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds scheduled backup specifications for a forest to a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest (for example, xdmp:forest("myforest")).
The scheduled backup specification(s), typically the result of an admin:forest-one-time-backup or an admin:forest-monthly-backup or an admin:forest-weekly-backup call

apidoc:function.name: forest-delete-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes scheduled backup specifications for a forest from a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest (for example, xdmp:forest("myforest")).
The scheduled backup(s) to delete. Typically, the result of an admin:forest-get-backups call.

apidoc:function.name: host-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function return the ID for the specified host from the configuration. The difference between this function and xdmp:host() is that the ID from this function can come from a host that has not yet been saved (that is, from a host that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created host without the need to first save the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the host. If the host is the current host, xdmp:host-name() returns the name.

apidoc:function.name: host-get-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name for the host with the specified ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: host-get-group
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the group ID for the host with the specified ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: host-get-port
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the bind port for the host with the specified ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: host-set-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the name of an existing host to the newly specified value.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.
The new name of the host.

apidoc:function.name: host-set-group
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the group to which an existing host belongs to the newly specified value.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.
The new group ID value (typically from a admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any group whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

apidoc:function.name: host-set-port
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the bind port value for the host to the newly specified value.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.
The new bind port value.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the type of appserver with the specified ID. It will be one of "http", "xdbc", "odbc", or "webDAV".

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-group-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the specified App Server's group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-host-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID(s) of the hosts the specified App Server's is currently running on.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the specified App Server (HTTP, XDBC, or ODBC). The difference between this function and xdmp:server is that the ID from this function can come from an appserver that has not yet been saved (that is, from an appserver that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created App Server without the need to first save the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The optional group-ids in which to restrict the appserver ids returned. If no group-id is specified, this function will return all matching appservers across all groups.
The name of the App Server.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of the appserver with the specified ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-root
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the root for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-port
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the port for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-modules-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the database set as the modules database for the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:usage.p: This function throws an exception if the specified App Server is a WebDAV server (because WebDAV servers do not use a modules database).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the database to which the App Server is set to execute queries against for the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-last-login
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the database to which the App Server stores users' last login information.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-display-last-login
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of the whether or not the appserver should display users' last login information.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-address
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the IP address of the App Server configuration. The default is 0.0.0.0.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-backlog
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the socket listen backlog setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-threads
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the maximum number of threads configured for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-request-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the request timeout value configured for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-keep-alive-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the keep alive timeout value configured for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-session-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the session timeout value configured for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-connection-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the connection timeout value configured for the specified App Server; the value applies only to an ODBC server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-default-time-limit
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the default time limit value configured for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

The new integer timeout value (specifies the number of seconds).

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the max SQL query time limit (the maximum total amount of time to service a SQL query before the App Server throws a timeout exception) in the configuration for the specified App Server; the value applies only to an ODBC server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The limit for the number of pre-commit triggers a single statement can invoke.
