apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A valid collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-authentication
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the authentication scheme in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The authentication scheme (basic, digest, digestbasic, application-level, kerberos-ticket, or certificate).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-default-user
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the default user (for use with application-level authentication) in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The user ID of the user to set as the default user.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-privilege
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets an execute privilege in the configuration for the specified App Server. When a privilege is set, the user who makes a request to the App Server must have been granted (via a role, either directly or indirectly) the specified privilege.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The privilege ID of an execute privilege needed to access this App Server.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-concurrent-request-limit
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the limit on concurrent requests that any user may have on a particular appserver. Setting the limit to 0 indicates there is no bound on the number of concurrent requests.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The limit of concurrent requests.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-file-log-level
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the host file log level setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The new log level (must be one of finest, finer, fine, debug, config, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-log-errors
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the log errors setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value specifying whether to allow send uncaught exceptions on this App Server to the ErrorLog.txt file (true) or not (false).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-debug-allow
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the debug allow setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value specifying whether to allow debugging on this App Server (true) or not (false).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-profile-allow
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the profile allow setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value specifying whether to allow profiling on this App Server (true) or not (false).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-default-xquery-version
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the default XQuery version setting in the configuration for this App Server. This setting determines the XQuery dialect used in queries against this App Server when one is not explicitly specified in the XQuery version declaration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default XQuery version value, one of 1.0-ml, 1.0, or 0.9-ml.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-multi-version-concurrency-control
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary:
This function sets the multi version concurrency control value in the configuration for this App Server. This option specifies how the latest timestamp is chosen for lock-free queries.
When set to contemporaneous, the server chooses the latest timestamp for which any transaction is known to have committed, even though there still may be other transactions for that timestamp that have not yet fully committed. Queries will see more timely results, but may block waiting for contemporaneous transactions to fully commit.
When set to nonblocking, the server chooses the latest timestamp for which all transactions are known to have committed, even though there may be a later timestamp for which another transaction has committed. Queries won't block waiting for transactions, but they may see less timely results.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The multi version concurrency control value, one of contemporaneous or nonblocking.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-distribute-timestamps
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary:
This function sets the distribute timestamps control value in the configuration for this App Server. This option specifies how the latest timestamp is distributed after updates. This affects performance of updates and the timeliness of read-after-write query results from other hosts in the group.
When set to fast, updates return as quicky as possible. No special timestamp notification messages are broadcasted to other hosts. Instead, timestamps are distributed to other hosts when any other message is sent. The maximum amount of time that could pass before other hosts see the update timestamp is one second, because a heartbeat message is sent to other hosts every second.
When set to strict, updates immediately broadcast timestamp notification messages to every other host in the group. Updates do not return until their timestamp has been distributed. This ensures timeliness of read-after-write query results from other hosts in the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The distribute timestamps value, one of fast or strict.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-sgml-character-entities
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the SGML character entity output setting in the configuration for the specified App Server. The SGML setting determines how characters that can be represented as SGML entites are serialized upon output by default in a query against the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for outputting SGML entities, one of none, default, math, or pub.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-encoding
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the value for the default output encoding in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for outputting characters. The value must be the name of a valid character set (for example, UTF-8, ASCII, and so on.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-error-handler
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the value of the path to the error handler in the configuration for the specified App Server. The path should specify a relative or absolute path to an XQuery module that is executed in the event of any 400 or 500 series HTTP errors (sometime known as a "sorry" server to give the user a clean error page).

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The path to the XQuery main module to execute when 400 or 500 series errors occur on the App Server.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-url-rewriter
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the value of the path to the URL rewriter in the configuration for the specified App Server. This function supports both the interpretive and declarative rewriters. The path should specify a relative or absolute path to either an XQuery module used as the interpretive rewriter or the XML file used by the declarative rewriter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The path to the XQuery main module (.xqy) or XML (.xml) to be used to rewrite URLs.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the enabled state in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The enabled state of the App Server to set, true for enabled and false for disabled.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-static-expires
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the value of the "expires" HTTP header for a specified App Server to the newly specified value.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The new value for the "expires" header.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-compute-content-length
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the value whether a WebDAV server computes content length.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The new value for compute content length.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-request-blackouts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the request blackouts specification for the specified appserver from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the appserver (for example, xdmp:server("myAppserver")).

apidoc:function.name: appserver-recurring-request-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a request-blackout specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A sequence of user ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
A sequence of role ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
The day(s) of the week. Must be a sequence of zero or more of monday, tuesday, wednesday, thusday, friday, saturday, sunday.
A time for the request blackout to start.
A time for the request blackout to end.
The amount of time for the blackout to last.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-one-time-request-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a one-time request-blackout specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A sequence of user ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
A sequence of role ID(s) that the request blackout applies too.
The starting dateTime of the request blackout.
The ending dateTime of the request blackout.
The amount of time for the blackout to last.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-add-request-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a request blackout specification for a appserver to a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the appserver (for example, xdmp:server("myAppserver")).
The request blackout specification(s), typically the result of an admin:appserver-one-time-request-blackout or an admin:appserver-recurring-request-blackout call

apidoc:function.name: appserver-delete-request-blackout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a request blackout specification for a appserver from a configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the appserver (for example, xdmp:server("myAppserver")).
The request blackout(s) to delete. Typically, the result of an admin:appserver-get-request-blackouts call.

apidoc:function.name: group-schema
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a schema element with the specified prefix and URI.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI for the schema.
The schema location.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-add-schema
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a schema binding definition to the existing schema binding definitions in the configuration for the specified App Server. Schemas with a schema binding definition are automatically imported into queries run against the App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema>
Typically the result of an admin:group-schema call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-delete-schema
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a schema definition in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema>
Typically the result of an admin:group-schema call.

apidoc:function.name: group-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a namespace element with the specified prefix and URI.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace prefix.
The namespace URI.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-add-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more namespaces to an App Server configuration, which will predefine the namespace(s) for all requests evaluated against the App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration for the cluster, typically the result of admin:get-configuration() call.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

A list of namespaces to add. Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>
Typically the result of an admin:group-namespace call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-delete-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a namespace configuration from the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

A list of namespaces to add. Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>
Typically the result of an admin:group-namespace call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-delete
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes one or more App Servers in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID(s) of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: http-server-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new HTTP App Server with the specified name, root, and port in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The root of the App Server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The ID of the modules database (for example, xdmp:database("Modules")). To specify the filesystem, use 0 or "file-system"
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any group or database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group and/or database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

apidoc:function.name: xdbc-server-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new XDBC App Server with the specified name, root, and port in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The path to the module directory root of this XDBC server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The ID of the modules database (for example, xdmp:database("Modules")). To specify the filesystem, use 0 or "file-system"
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any group or database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group and/or database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

apidoc:function.name: webdav-server-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new WebDAV App Server with the specified name, library, and port in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The root of the App Server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any group or database whose ID you pass into this function must exist when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to create the group and/or database, do so in a separate transaction before using them in in this function.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-copy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new App Server specification with the same settings as the App Server with the specified ID. The new App Server configuration will have the specified name. You can copy the App Server to a new one either in the same group (by specifying $old-group-id and $new-group-id with the same group ID) or in a different group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

The optional group ID of the new group to which the App Server is copied. If no ID is provided, the App Server will be copied to the same group it exists in. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new name for the App Server.
The port number for the new App Server.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the group. The difference between this function and xdmp:group() is that the ID from this function can come from a group that has not yet been saved (that is, from a group that has been created in the same query with the Admin library but has not yet been saved to the cluster configuration files). This ID enables you to completely configure a newly created group without the need to first save the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the name of the group with the specified ID to the specified name.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new name for the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-list-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the list cache size setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new list cache value (in megabytes).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-list-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the list cache partitions setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. More partitions allow more concurrency, but make each individual cache partition smaller, which could make it more likely for the cache to fill up. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A new value for the number of cache partitions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The server may use fewer or more partitions than the configured value to keep partition sizes between 2048 and 12288 megabytes.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-compressed-tree-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the compressed tree cache size setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new cache value (in megabytes).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-compressed-tree-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the compressed tree cache partitions setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. More partitions allow more concurrency, but make each individual cache partition smaller, which could make it more likely for the cache to fill up. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A new value for the number of cache partitions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The server may use fewer or more partitions than the configured value to keep partition sizes between 512 and 12288 megabytes.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-compressed-tree-read-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the compressed tree read size setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new read size value (in kilobytes).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-expanded-tree-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the expanded tree cache size setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new cache value (in megabytes).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-expanded-tree-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the expanded tree cache partitions setting of the group with the specified ID to the specified value. More partitions allow more concurrency, but make each individual cache partition smaller, which could make it more likely for the cache to fill up. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A new value for the number of cache partitions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The server may use fewer or more partitions than the configured value to keep partition sizes between 1024 and 12288 megabytes.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-retry-timeout

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new timeout setting (in seconds).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-module-cache-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of seconds a module can be unused before being flushed from caches. Larger values can potentially cause more memory to be used for cached modules. Smaller values can potentially cause more time to be used reloading uncached modules.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new timeout setting (in seconds).

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new log level (must be one of never, daily, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, sunday, monthly).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-keep-log-files
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the keep log files setting for the group in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A number indicating the number of log files to keep before deleting them.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-failover-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the failover enable setting for the group in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-trace-events-activated
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the value for trace events in the group configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new trace event value (true for enabled, false for disabled).

apidoc:function.name: group-add-schema
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a schema binding definition to the existing schema binding definitions in the configuration for the specified Group. Schemas with a schema binding definition are automatically imported into queries run against any App Server in the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema>
Typically the result of an admin:group-schema call.

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-schema
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a schema binding definition to the existing schema binding definitions in the configuration for the specified Group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

A list of schema specification elements of the form:
<schema xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <namespace-uri>foo</namespace-uri> <schema-location>/foo.xsd</schema-location> </schema>
Typically the result of an admin:group-schema call.

apidoc:function.name: group-add-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more namespaces to a Group configuration, which will predefine the namespace(s) for all requests evaluated against any App Server in the Group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

A list of namespaces to add. Typically the result of an admin:group-namespace call.
Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the specified namespaces from the configuration for the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

A list of namespaces to delete. Each namespace specification has the following form:
<namespace xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/group"> <prefix>myprefix</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://myuri/forthisprefix</namespace-uri> </namespace>
Typically the result of an admin:group-namespace call.

apidoc:function.name: group-trace-event
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an event element for the specified event name.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The exact name of the trace event.

apidoc:function.name: group-add-trace-event
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds trace events to the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
Zero or more event specifications, which you can construct with the admin:group-trace-event function.

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-trace-event
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the specified trace events from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
Zero or more event specifications, which you can construct with the admin:group-trace-event function.

apidoc:function.name: group-delete
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes one or more groups in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The IDs of the groups to be deleted. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: Any group whose ID you pass into this function must not have any hosts belonging to it when the transaction begins, otherwise an exception is thrown. If you need to delete the group, remove its hosts in a separate transaction before calling this function.

apidoc:function.name: group-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new group with the specified name in the configuration. The new group has the default values.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name for the new group.

apidoc:function.name: group-copy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new group specification with the same settings as the group with the specified ID. The new group configuration will have the specified name.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The name of the new group to create.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-rotate-audit-files
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the rotate audit files setting for the group in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new audit level (must be one of never, daily, monday, tuesday, wednesday, thursday, friday, saturday, sunday, monthly).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-keep-audit-files
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the keep audit files setting for the group in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A number indicating the number of audit log files to keep before deleting them.

apidoc:function.name: group-enable-audit-event-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the audit event type(s) enabled setting for the audit configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The event types to enable (must be one of: "amp-usage" "audit-configuration-change" "audit-shutdown" "audit-startup" "authentication-failure" "concurrent-request-denial" "configuration-change" "document-execute" "document-insert" "document-read" "document-update" "estimate" "eval" "exists" "lexicon-read" "no-permission" "no-privilege" "permission-change" "request-blackout-denial" "role-change-failure" "search" "security-access" "server-restart" "server-shutdown" "server-startup" "user-configuration-change" "user-role-addition" "user-role-removal" ).

apidoc:function.name: group-disable-audit-event-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the audit event type(s) enabled setting for the audit configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The event types to disable (must be one of: "amp-usage" "audit-configuration-change" "audit-shutdown" "audit-startup" "authentication-failure" "concurrent-request-denial" "configuration-change" "document-execute" "document-insert" "document-read" "document-update" "estimate" "eval" "exists" "lexicon-read" "no-permission" "no-privilege" "permission-change" "request-blackout-denial" "role-change-failure" "search" "security-access" "server-restart" "server-shutdown" "server-startup" "user-configuration-change" "user-role-addition" "user-role-removal" ).

apidoc:function.name: group-get-audit-event-type-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the audit event type's enabled setting for the audit configuration. A value of true is returned is the specified event type is set. Otherwise false is returned.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The event type to check (must be one of: "amp-usage" "audit-configuration-change" "audit-shutdown" "audit-startup" "authentication-failure" "concurrent-request-denial" "configuration-change" "document-execute" "document-insert" "document-read" "document-update" "estimate" "eval" "exists" "lexicon-read" "no-permission" "no-privilege" "permission-change" "request-blackout-denial" "role-change-failure" "search" "security-access" "server-restart" "server-shutdown" "server-startup" "user-configuration-change" "user-role-addition" "user-role-removal" ).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-audit-user-restriction
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function restricts the audit configuration by excluding or including by user.

The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The restriction type (must be one of: "inclusion" or "exclusion").

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-audit-uri-restriction

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The restriction type (must be one of: "inclusion" or "exclusion").
