apidoc:function.name: group-get-audit-excluded-uris
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the uris excluded from auditing. If auditing has a "inclusion" restriction, this function returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-audit-included-uris
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the uris included from auditing. If auditing has a "exclusion" restriction, this function returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-audit-outcome-restriction
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function restricts the audit configuration by auditing events only if they are "success" or "failure" events.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The outcomes to audit (must be one of: "success" or "failure" or "both").

apidoc:function.name: group-get-audit-outcome-restriction
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns whether auditing events are restricted by a success or failure outcome. Returns "success","failure", or "both"

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: mimetypes-add
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds mimetypes to the configuration. This function always requires a server restart to take effect.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
A mimetype specification, typically the result of an admin:mimetype call.

apidoc:function.name: mimetypes-delete
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes mimetypes from the configuration. This function always requires a server restart to take effect.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
A mimetype specification, typically the result of an admin:mimetype call.

apidoc:function.name: mimetypes-get
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the mimetypes from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: mimetype
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a mimetype specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the mimetype.
The extension(s) for the mimetype.
A valid format for the mimetype. Must be on of: binary,xml, or text.

apidoc:function.name: database-daily-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a daily scheduled database backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of days to elapse between each backup.
The time of day of the backup, in 24:00:00 notation.
The maximum number of backups to keep. When you reach the specified maximum number of backups, the next backup will delete the oldest backup. Specify 0 to keep an unlimited number of backups.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-daily-incremental-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a daily scheduled incremental database backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the full backup is located.
The number of days to elapse between each incremental backup.
The time of day to start the incremental backup, in 24:00:00 notation.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current incremental backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the incremental backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the incremental backup.
The directory in which to save the incremental backup.
Whether or not to purge journal archive after incremental backup is performed. Defaults to false
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-hourly-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an hourly scheduled database backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of hours to elapse between each backup.
The number of minutes after the hour to start the backup. Note that this setting does not add to the backup period value.
The maximum number of backups to keep. When you reach the specified maximum number of backups, the next backup will delete the oldest backup. Specify 0 to keep an unlimited number of backups.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-hourly-incremental-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs an hourly scheduled incremental database backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the full backup is located.
The number of hours to elapse between each incremental backup.
The number of minutes after the hour to start the incremental backup. Note that this setting does not add to the incremental backup period value.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current incremental backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the incremental backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
The directory in which to save the incremental backup.
Whether or not to purge journal archive after incremental backup is performed. Defaults to false
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-minutely-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a scheduled database backup specification on a number-of-minutes basis.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of minutes to elapse between each backup.
The maximum number of backups to keep. When you reach the specified maximum number of backups, the next backup will delete the oldest backup. Specify 0 to keep an unlimited number of backups.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the backup.
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: database-minutely-incremental-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a scheduled incremental database backup specification based on a number of minutes.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory where the full backup is located.
The number of minutes to elapse between each incremental backup.
Whether to backup the security database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the schemas database alongside the current incremental backup.
Whether to backup the triggers database alongside the current incremental backup.
If set to false, do not include the replicas in the incremental backup. The default is true, which means to include all replicas in the incremental backup.
The directory in which to save the incremental backup.
Whether or not to purge journal archive after incremental backup is performed. Defaults to false
Whether or not to enable journal archiving. Defaults to false.
Path for where archived journals are stored. Defaults to the backup data directory.
Maximum difference in seconds that the archived journal can lag behind its forest's active journal. Defaults to 900.

apidoc:function.name: forest-hourly-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a hourly scheduled forest backup specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of hours to elapse between each backup
The number of minutes after the hour to start the backup. Note that this setting does not add to the backup period value.

apidoc:function.name: forest-minutely-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a scheduled forest backup on a number-of-minutes basis.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of minutes to elapse between each backup

apidoc:function.name: group-get-scheduled-tasks
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all of the tasks scheduled for the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group on which the scheduled tasks are configured. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-add-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds one or more scheduled tasks to the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group on which the scheduled tasks are configured. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
One or more scheduled tasks, such as those created by the task-create functions.

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes one or more scheduled tasks from the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group on which the scheduled tasks are configured. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
One or more scheduled tasks.

apidoc:function.name: group-one-time-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked once, at a specific calendar day and time.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The date and time on which the task is to start.
The ID of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The ID of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The ID of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The ID of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

apidoc:function.name: group-monthly-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at monthly intervals.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of months to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The day of the month to invoke the module.
The time of day (in 24:00 notation) to invoke the module.
The ID of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The ID of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The ID of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The ID of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

apidoc:function.name: group-weekly-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at weekly intervals.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of weeks to elapse between each invocation of the module.
One or more days on the specified week to invoke the module
The time of day (in 24:00 notation) to invoke the module.
The ID of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The ID of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The ID of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The ID of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

apidoc:function.name: group-daily-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at daily intervals.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (files system) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of days to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The time of day (in 24:00 notation) to invoke the module.
The ID of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The ID of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The ID of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The ID of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

apidoc:function.name: group-hourly-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at hourly intervals.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (filesystem) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of hours to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The number of minutes after the hour to invoke the module. This value must be 59 or less. Note that this setting does not add to the task-period value.
The ID of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The ID of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The ID of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The ID of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

apidoc:function.name: group-minutely-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a task to be invoked at intervals defined in terms of minutes.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the module to be invoked. The task path must begin with a forward slash (/) and cannot contain a question mark '?', colon ':' or pound '#' character.
The root directory (filesystem) or URI root (database) that contains the module. For example, if the module is located in the filesystem under MarkLogic/Docs, specify Docs.
The number of minutes to elapse between each invocation of the module.
The ID of the database on which the module is to be invoked.
The ID of the modules database. For example, xdmp:database("Modules"). To specify the filesystem, use 0.
The ID of the user with permission to invoke the module. For example, xdmp:user("Jim").
The ID of the host on which to invoke the module. Leave empty, (), to specify all hosts.
The priority of the task. Either "normal" or "higher".

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-certificate-template
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the SSL certificate template used by the specified App Server. If no template is set for the App Server, 0 is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-ciphers
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the SSL ciphers set for the App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-hostname
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the SSL hostname for the specified App Server. If no hostname is set, nothing is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-certificate-template
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets an SSL certificate template for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The ID of the certificate template. This would typically be the result of a pki:insert-template(pki:create-template()) call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-ciphers
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets SSL ciphers for the specified App Server. This is the standard cipher specification string for OpenSSL.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The SSL ciphers to set.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-hostname
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary:
This function sets an SSL hostname for the specified App Server.
The SSL hostname should only be set when a proxy or load balancer is used to represent multiple servers. In this case, you can specify an SSL hostname with this function and all instances of the application server will identify themselves as that host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The SSL hostname.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-allow-sslv3
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the SSL v3 protocol is enabled for the specified App Server, or false if SSL v3 is disabled.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-allow-tls
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the TLS protocol is enabled for the specified App Server, or false if TLS is disabled.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-disabled-protocols
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the disabled protocols for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-client-certificate-authorities
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id(s) of the client certificate authority for the specified App Server. If no client certificate authority is set, this function returns an empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-allow-sslv3
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables the SSL v3 protocol for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-allow-tls
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables the TLS protocol for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-disabled-protocols
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function set the disabled protocols for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The disabled protocols to set: "SSLv3", "TLSv1", "TLSv1_1" or "TLSv1_2".

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-client-certificate-authorities
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets one or more client certificate authorities that sign client certificates for the specified App Server. This function is typically used along with the pki:insert-trusted-certificates and pki:get-trusted-certificate-ids functions to import trusted Certificate Authorities for client certificates.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
One or more ids for trusted certificates generated by the certificate authority to be set.

apidoc:function.name: forest-daily-backup
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a daily scheduled forest backup.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The directory to save the backup.
The number of days to elapse between each backup.
The time of day of the backup, in 24:00:00 notation.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-tf-normalization
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function specifies whether to use the default term-frequency normalization (scaled-log), which scales the term frequency based on the size of the document, or to use the unscaled-log, which uses term frequency as a function of the actual term frequency in a document, regardless of the document size.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The new term-frequency normalization setting. Must be one of: scaled-log or unscaled-log.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-tf-normalization
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the current term-frequency normalization setting for the database. The returned value is either (scaled-log), which means to scale the term frequency based on the size of the document, or unscaled-log, which means to use term frequency as a function of the actual term frequency in a document, regardless of the document size.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: group-get-xdqp-ssl-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if SSL is enabled for the group. Otherwise, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-xdqp-ssl-allow-sslv3
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the SSL v3 protocol is enabled for the group. Otherwise, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-xdqp-ssl-allow-tls
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the TLS protocol is enabled for the group. Otherwise, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-xdqp-ssl-disabled-protocols
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the disabled protocols for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-xdqp-ssl-ciphers
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the SSL ciphers set for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-xdqp-ssl-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables SSL for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.
Specify true to enable SSL for the group or false to disable SSL.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-xdqp-ssl-allow-sslv3
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables the SSL v3 protocol for the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.
Specify true to enable the SSL v3 protocol for the group or false to disable the SSL v3 protocol.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-xdqp-ssl-allow-tls
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables the TLS protocol for the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.
Specify true to enable the TLS protocol for the group or false to disable the TLS protocol.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-xdqp-ssl-disabled-protocols
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the disabled protocols for the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.
The disabled protocols to set: "SSLv3", "TLSv1", "TLSv1_1" or "TLSv1_2".

apidoc:function.name: group-set-xdqp-ssl-ciphers
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets SSL ciphers for the specified group. This is the standard cipher specification string for OpenSSL.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group.
The SSL ciphers to set.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-ssl-require-client-certificate
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if a client certificate is required for the specified App Server. Otherwise, it returns false.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-ssl-require-client-certificate
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function determines whether or not a client certificate is required for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-exists
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function determines whether or not the specified database exists. Returns true if the database exists, otherwise false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the database to check.

apidoc:function.name: forest-exists
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function determines whether or not the specified forest exists. Returns true if the forest exists, otherwise false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the forest to check.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the database that uses the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest used by the database to be returned (for example, xdmp:forest("myForest")).

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the IDs of the forest replicas for the specified forest. If it returns the empty sequence, then no replacas are assigned to the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest having the replica forests to be returned (for example, xdmp:forest("myForest")).

apidoc:function.name: forest-add-replica
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a forest replica to a master forest. Note that adding a replica forest will take the master forest offline for a period ranging between a few seconds to a few minutes.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the master forest to which to add the replica forest (for example, xdmp:forest("MasterForest")).
The ID of the replica forest to add to the master forest (for example, xdmp:forest("ReplicaForest")).

apidoc:function.name: forest-remove-replica
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function removes a forest replica from a master forest. Note that removing a replica forest will take the master forest offline for a period ranging between a few seconds to a few minutes.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the master forest from which to remove the replica forest (for example, xdmp:forest("MasterForest")).
The ID of the replica forest to remove from the master forest (for example, xdmp:forest("ReplicaForest")).

apidoc:function.name: host-exists
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function determines whether or not the specified Host exists. Returns true if the Host exists, otherwise false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the host to check.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-exists
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function determines whether or not the specified App Server (HTTP, XDBC, or ODBC) exists. Returns true if the App Server exists, otherwise false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The list of group IDs returned from the admin:get-group-ids function.
The name of the App Server to check.

apidoc:function.name: group-exists
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function determines whether or not the specified Group exists. Returns true if the Group exists, otherwise false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the group to check.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-field-value-positions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the field value positions setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database to copy (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-field-value-searches
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the field value searches setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database to copy (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-field-value-positions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the field value positions setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database to copy (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-field-value-searches
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the field value search setting for the specified field.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database to copy (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-preload-replica-mapped-data
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the preload-replica-mapped-data setting for the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-preload-replica-mapped-data
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the preload replica mapped data setting for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns a replica database configuration. Use the output of this function in the admin:database-set-foreign-replicas function to place the replica database configuration into the cluster configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The ID of the foreign cluster containing the replica database.
The ID of the replica database.

Boolean that indicates whether to connect to forests by name. If fn:true, forests will automatically connect to/from foreign forests of the same name. If false, forests must be individually configured to replicate to/from foreign forests. Individual forest settings override the database level setting.

This parameter controls how far (in seconds) the replica may fall behind before the master stops accepting updates. If contact with the foreign cluster is lost, a warning will be logged and master forests will permit updates to proceed with no enforcement of the lag limit.
This parameter controls if replication is enabled. Set to true to enable, false to disable.
This parameter specifies the number of frames in the queue for foreign replication, or the number of fragments if you are doing bulk replication. The default is 10.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-get-cluster-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the replica cluster from the replica database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign replica configuration element.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-get-database-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the replica database from the replica database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign replica configuration element.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-get-connect-forests-by-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the connect-forests-by-name setting from the replica database configuration. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration element for the foreign replicas.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-get-lag-limit
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the lag limit value from the replica database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration element for the foreign replica database.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-set-lag-limit
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the lag limit value on a replica database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration element for the foreign replica database.
The lag limit.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-get-replication-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the enabled flag from the replica database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration element for the foreign replica database.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-set-replication-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the enabled flag on a replica database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration element for the foreign replica database.
The enabled flag.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns a master database configuration. Use the output of this function in the admin:database-set-foreign-master function to set the master database configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The ID of the foreign cluster containing the master host.
The ID of the master database.

Boolean that indicates whether to connect to forests by name. If fn:true, forests will automatically connect to/from foreign forests of the same name. If false, forests must be individually configured to replicate to/from foreign forests. Individual forest settings override the database level setting.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-master-get-cluster-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the cluster from the specified foreign master configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign master configuration.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-master-get-database-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the foreign master database. This function must be executed on the replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign master configuration.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-master-get-connect-forests-by-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the connect-forests-by-name setting from the master database configuration. This function must be executed on the replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The configuration element for the foreign master.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures the specified replica database to receive replicated data from the specified foreign master. This function must be executed on the replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The foreign master configuration returned by the admin:database-foreign-master function.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function removes the specified master database from the database replication configuration on the replica host. This function must be executed on the replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the domestic database whose foreign master is to be removed from the database replication configuration.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the configuration for the foreign master database. This function must be executed on the replica host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds one or more replica databases to the database replication configuration. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replica database to be added.
One or more replica database configuration elements. More than one replica database elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the foreign replica database configuration. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
One or more replica configuration elements. More than one replica database elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the foreign replica database configurations for the specified master database. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

The configuration elements for the replica databases. These configuration elements can be returned using the admin:database-get-foreign-replicas function. More than one replica database elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the configuration elements of the replica databases associated with the master database specified by database-id. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-replica
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns a replica forest configuration. Use the output of this function in the admin:forest-set-foreign-replicas function to place the replica forest configuration into the cluster configuration. This function must be executed on the master host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The ID of the foreign cluster containing the replica host.
The ID of the replica database.
The ID of the foreign forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-replica-get-cluster-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the replica cluster from the specified replica forest configuration element. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica or admin:forest-get-foreign-replicas function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-replica-get-database-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the replica database from the specified replica forest configuration element. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica or admin:forest-get-foreign-replicas function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-replica-get-forest-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the replica forest from the specified replica forest configuration element. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica or admin:forest-get-foreign-replicas function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a replicaton configuration element for the specified master forest. This function must be executed on the replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The ID of the master cluster.
The ID of the master database.
The ID of the master forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-master-get-cluster-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID for the cluster from the foreign master forest configuration element.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-master or admin:forest-get-foreign-master function that specifies the configuration for the master forest. More than one forest master configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-master-get-database-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id for the database from the foreign master forest configuration element.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-master or admin:forest-get-foreign-master function that specifies the configuration for the master forest. More than one forest master configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-foreign-master-get-forest-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id for the forest from the foreign master forest configuration element.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-master or admin:forest-get-foreign-master function that specifies the configuration for the master forest. More than one forest master configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function writes the specified foreign master forest configuration into the database replication configuration. Any forest-level configuration will override the database level-configuration. This function must be executed on the replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replica forest associated with the master forest to be set.

The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-master or admin:forest-get-foreign-master function that specifies the configuration for the master forest. More than one forest master configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-delete-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the master forest associated with the specified replica forest from the database replication configuration. This function must be executed on the replica host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replica forest associated with the master forest to be deleted from the database replication configuration.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-foreign-master
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the replication configuration for the master forest associated with the specified replica forest. This function must be executed on the replica host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replica forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-add-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds the replica forest that is associated with the specified master forest to the database replication configuration. This function must be executed on the master host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest on the master host to be replicated.

The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest. More than one forest replica configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function writes the specified replica forest configuration into the database replication configuration. Any forest-level configuration will override the database level-configuration. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest on the master host to be replicated.

The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest. More than one forest replica configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-delete-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the foreign replica of the specified forest on the master host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replicated forest on the master host.

The element returned by the admin:forest-get-foreign-replicas function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest. More than one forest replica configuration elements may be specified in a one-to-many replication scheme.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-foreign-replicas
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the foreign replicas configuration element. This function must be executed on the master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the master forest.

apidoc:function.name: host-get-foreign-port
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the port used by the specified host to listen for communications from foreign hosts.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the domestic host.

apidoc:function.name: host-set-foreign-port
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures the specified domestic host to listen for communications from foreign hosts over the specified port.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the domestic host.
The port number on which to listen for communications.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of this cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of this cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the name for this cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name to be assigned to this cluster.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-xdqp-ssl-certificate
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the SSL certificate used to establish secure communication between this cluster and foreign clusters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The SSL certificate for this cluster.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-certificate
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the SSL certificate used to establish secure communication between this cluster and foreign clusters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-private-key
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the private key for secure communication between this cluster and foreign clusters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-xdqp-ssl-private-key
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the SSL private key for secure communication between this cluster and foreign clusters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The private SSL key for this cluster.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-xdqp-bootstrap-hosts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the bootstrap hosts for the domestic cluster. Bootstrap hosts are accessed by hosts on foreign clusters to establish communication with the domestic cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
One or more ids for hosts to be used as bootstrap hosts for this cluster.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-xdqp-bootstrap-hosts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ids of the bootstrap hosts configured for this cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-language-baseline
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the language baseline of this cluster, either "legacy" or "ml9". The language baseline defines the default language configuration to use. Clusters upgraded from MarkLogic server version 8 will have a language baseline of "legacy".

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-language-baseline
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the language baseline for this cluster. A change to the language baseline requires a restart of the cluster and a reindex to avoid stemming and tokenization anomalies.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The language baseline to be used in this cluster, either "legacy" or "ml9".

apidoc:function.name: foreign-host
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures a foreign host to be set by the admin:foreign-cluster-set-bootstrap-hosts function as the bootstrap host for the foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The ID of the foreign host.
The name of the foreign host.
The port on which the foreign bootstrap host will listen for connections. This should be port 7998 in most situations.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-host-get-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the foreign bootstrap host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign host configuration element returned by the admin:foreign-host or admin:foreign-cluster-get-bootstrap-hosts function.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-host-get-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of the foreign bootstrap host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign host configuration element returned by the admin:foreign-host or admin:foreign-cluster-get-bootstrap-hosts function.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-host-get-connect-port
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the number of the port configured for the foreign bootstrap host.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The foreign host configuration element returned by the admin:foreign-host or admin:foreign-cluster-get-bootstrap-hosts function.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-delete
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the configuration for the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-replace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function replaces a configuration for a foreign cluster with a new configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The name of the foreign cluster.
The XDQP timeout setting (in seconds) for the foreign cluster.
the host timeout setting (in seconds) for the foreign cluster.
The SSL certificate returned by the admin:cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-certificate function on the foreign cluster.
Specify fn:true() to enable SSL for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable SSL.
Specify fn:true() to enable the SSL v3 protocol for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable the SSL v3 protocol.
Specify fn:true() to enable the TLS protocol for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable the TLS protocol.
The SSL ciphers to set. This can be any standard cipher specification string for OpenSSL.
The boot strap host configuration returned from the admin:foreign-host function. You can specify multiple bootstrap hosts on a cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a complete configuration for a foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster, obtained by running the admin:cluster-get-id function on the foreign cluster.
The name of the foreign cluster.
The XDQP timeout setting (in seconds) for the foreign cluster.
the host timeout setting (in seconds) for the foreign cluster.
The SSL certificate returned by the admin:cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-certificate function on the foreign cluster.
Specify fn:true() to enable SSL for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable SSL.
Specify fn:true() to enable the SSL v3 protocol for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable the SSL v3 protocol.
Specify fn:true() to enable the TLS protocol for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable the TLS protocol.
The SSL ciphers to set. This can be any standard cipher specification string for OpenSSL.
The boot strap host configuration returned from the admin:foreign-host function. You can specify multiple bootstrap hosts on a cluster.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-foreign-cluster-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ids of the foreign clusters.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-foreign-cluster-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the id of the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The name of the cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the name of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-name
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the name of a foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The name to be set for the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-xdqp-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the timeout (in seconds) for XDQP communication between data nodes and evaluator nodes in the domestic cluster and their counterparts in the foreign cluster. By default, the XDQP timeout setting is 10 seconds.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The timeout setting (in seconds).

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-xdqp-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the timeout setting (in seconds) for XDQP communication between data nodes and evaluator nodes in the domestic cluster and their counterparts in the foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-host-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the timeout period (in seconds) for communication between domestic hosts and hosts in the specified foreign cluster. By default, the host timeout setting is 30 seconds.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The timeout setting (in seconds).

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-host-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the timeout period (in seconds) for communication between domestic hosts and hosts in the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-ssl-certificate
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the SSL certificate used to communicate with hosts in the foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-ssl-certificate
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the specified SSL certificate for secure communication with hosts in a foreign cluster. This certificate is shared by all hosts in the cluster when communicating with foreign hosts.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The SSL certificate returned by the admin:cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-certificate function on the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if SSL is enabled for the foreign cluster. Otherwise, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-xdqp-ssl-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables SSL for the foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
Specify fn:true() to enable SSL for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable SSL.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-allow-sslv3
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the SSL v3 protocol is enabled for the foreign cluster. Otherwise, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-xdqp-ssl-allow-sslv3
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables the SSL v3 protocol for the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
Specify fn:true() to enable the SSL v3 protocol for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable the SSL v3 protocol.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-allow-tls
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the TLS protocol is enabled for the foreign cluster. Otherwise, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-xdqp-ssl-allow-tls
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables the TLS protocol for the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
Specify fn:true() to enable the TLS protocol for the foreign cluster or fn:false() to disable the TLS protocol.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-xdqp-ssl-ciphers
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the SSL ciphers set for the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-xdqp-ssl-ciphers
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets SSL ciphers for the specified foreign cluster. The value parameter can be any standard cipher specification string for OpenSSL.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The SSL ciphers to set.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-get-bootstrap-hosts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns one or more configuration elements that identify the bootstrap hosts on the specified foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.

apidoc:function.name: foreign-cluster-set-bootstrap-hosts
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function identifies the foreign host to be used to bootstrap communication with the foreign cluster. When a bootstrap host on a foreign cluster initially starts, it will bootstrap communications by establishing a connection to one or more of the hosts on this cluster. Once a connection has been established between cluster hosts, the bootstrap host retrieves configuration information to identify which foreign hosts are responsible for specific foreign forests.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster.
The boot strap host configuration returned from the admin:foreign-host function. You can specify multiple bootstrap hosts on a cluster.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-large-size-threshold
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the threshold at which binary documents in the specified database should be handled as binary large objects (BLOBs). Binary documents less than or equal to the threshold are treated as small binary objects, stored in stands. Binary documents larger than the threshold are stored in the Large Data Directory for more efficient memory consumption.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-fast-data-directory
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the directory path set in the fast data directory field for the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-fast-data-max-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns maximum allowable size (in megabytes) of the data to be kept by the specified forest in its fast-data-directory, or 0 for no limit.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-foreign-replica-databases
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function is executed on the master cluster to return the replication configuration for the specified local database to the specified foreign replica cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign replica cluster.
The ID of the master database on the local cluster.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-foreign-master-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function is executed on a replica cluster to return the replication configuration for the specified local database from the specified foreign master cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign master cluster.
The ID of the replica database on the local cluster.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-config-for-foreign-replicas-on-foreign-cluster
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the replica configuration on a foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster containing the replica host.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-config-for-foreign-master-on-foreign-cluster
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the master configuration on a foreign cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the foreign cluster containing the replica host.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output CDATA section localname setting for the specified App Server.

The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-escape-uri-attributes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output escape URI attributes setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-include-content-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output include content type setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-indent
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output indent setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-indent-tabs
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output indent tab settings for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:example.pre:
let $config := admin:get-configuration() let $groupid := admin:group-get-id($config, "Default") return admin:appserver-get-output-indent-tabs($config, admin:appserver-get-id($config, $groupid, "myAppServer"))
(: returns the new configuration element -- use admin:save-configuration to save the changes to the configuration or pass the configuration to other Admin API functions to make other changes. :)

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-indent-untyped
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output indent untyped setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-media-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output media type setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output normalization form setting for the specified App Server.

The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output omit XML declaration setting for the specified App Server.
