The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-standalone
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output standalone setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-undeclare-prefixes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output undeclare prefixes setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-version
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output version setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-output-include-default-attributes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value for the output include default attributes setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-method
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures the default output serialization method for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for the serialization method, one of xml, html, xhtml, text, sparql-results-json, sparql-results-csv, n-triples, n-quads, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-byte-order-mark
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether for the specified App Server the output sequence of octets is or is not to be preceded by a byte order mark by default.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for outputting a byte order mark, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-cdata-section-namespace-uri
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the namespace URI for any CDATA section localnames configured for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A namespace URI for CDATA section elements.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-cdata-section-localname
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the default element localname or list of element localnames to be output as CDATA sections for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A CDATA section element localname or space-separated list of CDATA section element localnames.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-doctype-public
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures a default public identifier to use on the emitted DOCTYPE for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A public identifier URI.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-doctype-system
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures a default system identifier to use on the emitted DOCTYPE for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A system identifier URI.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-escape-uri-attributes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether or not to apply Unicode normalization, percent-encoding, and HTML escaping when serializing URI attributes by default for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for escaping serialized URI attributes, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-include-content-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether or not to include the content-type declaration when serializing nodes for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for including a content-type declaration, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-indent
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether or not to pretty-print (indent) typed XML (that is, XML for which there is an in-scope schema) output for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for indenting output for typed XML, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-indent-tabs
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether or not to set tabs (indent) in typed XML output(that is, XML for which there is an in-scope schema) for the specified App Server. Tabs are used to replace 8 spaces, so tabs only used when the element depth reaches 4 spaces. This function enables you to turn off tabs (for example, "indent-tabs=no").

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for indenting output for typed XML, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-indent-untyped
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether or not to pretty-print (indent) untyped XML (that is, XML for which there is no in-scope schema) output for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for indenting output for typed XML, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-media-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the default serialization media type for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for output media type, a MIME type string such as text/xml.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-normalization-form
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets a Unicode normalization form to be applied by default to serialized output for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for the output normalization form, one of none, NFC, NFD, or NFKD.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-omit-xml-declaration
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether serialized output for the specified App Server should omit the inclusion of an XML declaration by default.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for omitting the XML declaration, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-standalone
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether for the specified App Server an XML delcaration in serialized output should include a standalone attribute by default.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
For a value of yes or no, include standalone=value in the XML declaration; for a value of omit, omit standalone=.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-undeclare-prefixes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether by default, serialization for the specified App Server should undeclare the namespace prefix of any child element that does not bind the prefix of its parent element.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for undeclaring prefixes, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-version
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function stipulates a version of the default serialization method associated with the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A release version string, one of 1.0 or 4.0.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-output-include-default-attributes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function configures whether for the specified App Server, attributes defaulted with a schema should be included in the serialization.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The default value for including default attributes in serialization, one of yes, no, or default.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-foreign-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a foreign database to a database

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replica database to be added.
The ID of the foreign cluster containing the replica host.
The ID of the replica database.

apidoc:function.name: database-remove-foreign-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function removes a foreign database from a database

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the replica database to be added.
The ID of the foreign cluster containing the replica host.
The ID of the replica database.

apidoc:function.name: database-path-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a namespace element with the specified prefix and URI.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace prefix.
The namespace URI.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-path-namespaces
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of any namespace definitions predefined for the specified database. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:example.pre:
xquery version "1.0-ml";
import module namespace admin = "http://marklogic.com/xdmp/admin" at "/MarkLogic/admin.xqy"; admin:database-get-path-namespaces(admin:get-configuration(), xdmp:database("Documents")) => <path-namespace xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/database"> <prefix>aaa</prefix> <namespace-uri>http://aaa.com</namespace-uri> </path-namespace>

apidoc:function.name: database-in-use-path-namespace-prefixes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the prefixes of all the namespaces that are in use by some path or geospatial path index. If none is used by any path, returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-add-path-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more namespaces to a database configuration, which will predefine the namespace(s) for all XPath expressions used in range index definitions.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The namespace specification to be added.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-path-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the specified namespaces from the configuration for the specified database. If the namespace is already in use in an index path expression, then ADMIN-PATHNAMESPACEINUSE error is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The namespace specification that needs to be deleted.

apidoc:function.name: database-range-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a path range index specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
A valid XPath expression.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.
A boolean specifying whether to maintain value postions in this index (used with co-occurrences).
An option to handle values that do not meet the range index type. Must be one of: reject,ignore.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-range-path-indexes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the range path indexes specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-add-range-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a range path index to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An path range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-path-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-range-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a range path index for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
An path range index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-range-path-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-geospatial-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a geospatial path index specification. For usage details, see Geospatial Path Point Queries and Indexes in the Search Developer's Guide.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid XPath expression.
The coordinate system. Must be one of wgs84, wgs84/double, etrs89, etrs89/double, raw, raw/double.
A boolean specifying whether to maintain value postions in this index (used with co-occurrences).

The point format in the data: "point" means latitude precedes longitude (this is the default); "long-lat-point" means longitude precedes latitude. To use the default value of "point", simply omit this parameter. Do not specify an empty string.
An option to handle values that do not meet the range index type. Must be one of: reject,ignore.

apidoc:example.pre:
xquery version "1.0-ml";
import module namespace admin = "http://marklogic.com/xdmp/admin" at "/MarkLogic/admin.xqy"; admin:database-geospatial-path-index( "/aaa:a/aaa:b", "wgs84", fn:false(), "long-lat-point", "reject" ) => <geospatial-path-index xmlns="http://marklogic.com/xdmp/database"> <path-expression>/aaa:a/aaa:b</path-expression> <coordinate-system>wgs84</coordinate-system> <point-format>long-lat-point</point-format> <range-value-positions>false</range-value-positions> <invalid-values>reject</invalid-values> </geospatial-path-index>

apidoc:function.name: database-get-geospatial-path-indexes
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the geospatial path indexes specification(s) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-add-geospatial-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a range path index to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A geospatial path index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-geospatial-path-index call.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-geospatial-path-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a geospatial path index for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A geospatial path index specification, typically the result of an admin:database-geospatial-path-index call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-odbcserver-ids
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ids of all of the ODBC App Servers in the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: odbc-server-create
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a new ODBC App Server with the specified name, root, and port in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The name of the App Server. The name must be unique among the App Server names for the group.
The root of the App Server.
The port on which the App Server listens. The port must be available on the host.
The ID of the modules database (for example, xdmp:database("Modules")). To specify the filesystem, use 0 or "file-system"
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-ssl-fips-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true when OpenSSL FIPS 140-2 mode is enabled in the cluster configuration. If OpenSSL FIPS 140-2 mode is not enabled, false is returned.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-ssl-fips-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables OpenSSL FIPS 140-2 mode for the cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
Specify true to enable FIPS 140-2 mode for the cluster. Specify false to disable FIPS 140-2 mode for the cluster.

apidoc:function.name: database-validate-path-expression
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function validates the specified path expression, along with any namespaces used in the path expression.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The path expression to validate.
Specify fn:true() to ignore any namespaces used in the path expression. Otherwise, specify fn:false() to validate namespaces.

apidoc:function.name: database-validate-path-namespaces
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns any undefined namespace prefixes used in a path expression.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The path expression to validate.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-background-io-limit
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the value for the I/O background limit that controls the I/O resoources that I/O tasks (for example, merges) will consume. If the limit is reached, then merges are throttled back to limit their maximum I/O. This can help in situations when the I/O system on the computer is maxed out. In normal operations, you should not need to set this parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-background-io-limit
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets a limit on the amount of I/O that background tasks (for example, merges) will consume. If the limit is reached, then merges are throttled back to limit their maximum I/O. This can help in situations when the I/O system on the computer is maxed out. In normal operations, you should not need to set this parameter.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A number representing the maximum amount of I/O, in megabytes-per-second, to allow for each host in the group.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-s3-domain
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the simple storage service internet domain name for hosts in the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-s3-domain
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the simple storage service internet domain name for hosts in the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A string specifying the internet domain name of the simple storage service. To access a different simple storage services that is API compatible with Amazon S3, specify it here.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-s3-protocol
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the simple storage service protocol for hosts in the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-s3-protocol
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the simple storage service protocol for hosts in the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

A string specifying the protocol to use when accessing the simple storage service. The choices are "http" and "https". The default is "http". To use a more secure protocol when accessing the simple storage service, choose "https".

apidoc:function.name: group-get-s3-server-side-encryption
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the method of server side encryption for data at rest on the simple storage service.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-s3-server-side-encryption
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the method of server side encryption for data at rest on the simple storage service.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

A string specifying the method of server side encryption for data at rest on the simple storage service. The choices are "none" and "aes256". The default is "none". To specify server side encryption for data at rest on the simple storage service, choose "aes256".

apidoc:function.name: group-get-security-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the ID of the security database for the specified group from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-security-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the security database for a group to the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The new database ID for the auxiliary database.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-rewrite-resolves-globally
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the value for the rewrite-resolves-globally property, which allows rewritten URLs to be resolved from the marklogic-dir/Modules directory as well as from the App Server root.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-rewrite-resolves-globally
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the value for the rewrite-resolves-globally property, which allows rewritten URLs to be resolved from the marklogic-dir/Modules directory as well as from the App Server root. This function requires a restart of MarkLogic Server for a change to this setting to take effect.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
Set to fn:true to enable, fn:false to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-field-path
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function is a constructor for field-path element. The field path element is used to construct a field.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid XPath expression.
The path weight used in relavance calculations.

apidoc:function.name: database-path-field
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a field specification that has field paths.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The name of the field.
The field paths specification, typically the result of one or more calls for admin:database-field-path.

apidoc:function.name: database-validate-field-paths
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function checks if the paths conform to the permissible XPath syntax. If any of the paths doesn't, it will return an error. Conformance to the permissible syntax for an individual path can also be checked using function cts:valid-index-path.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The sequence of field-path elements, typically created using admin:database-field-path call.

apidoc:function.name: database-validate-path-fields
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: For a given sequence of fields, this function validates all the paths on each field using admin:database-validate-field-paths call.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
A sequence of fields that will be validated for paths.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-field-paths
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes paths from a specified field.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
The sequence of field-path elements, typically created using admin:database-field-path call.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-field-paths
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds given paths to the field specified by field-name.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
The sequence of field-path elements, typically created using admin:database-field-path call.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-field-paths
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns all the paths on a given field.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.

apidoc:function.name: forest-rename
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function renames a forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.
New name to give the forest.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-triple-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the triple index on or off for a database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
Set to fn:true to enable the triple index, fn:false to disable it.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-triple-positions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the triple positions of a database to true or false.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
A boolean value of triple positions to set on database.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-in-memory-triple-index-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the size, in megabytes, of the in-memory triple index. This is used for memory to manage triple index data in in-memory stands.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The value representing the number of megabytes of memory for the in-memory triple index.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-triple-index
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true if the triple index is enabled for the specified database, false if it is not enabled.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-triple-positions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns triple positions setting of a database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: database-get-in-memory-triple-index-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the in memory triple index size setting (in megabytes) for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.name: group-get-triple-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of the triple cache size for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-triple-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the number of triple cache partitions configured for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-triple-value-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the size of triple value cache configured for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-triple-value-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the number of triple value cache partitions configured for the group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-triple-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of triple cache partitions to allocate. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The size (in megabytes) to set the triple cache.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-triple-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of partitions to allocate for the triple index cache. More partitions allow more concurrency, but make each individual cache partition smaller, which could make it more likely for the cache to fill up. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A new value for the number of cache partitions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The server may use fewer or more partitions than the configured value to keep partition sizes between 1024 and 12288 megabytes.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-triple-value-cache-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the size of the value cache for the triple index. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The size (in megabytes) to set the triple value cache.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-triple-value-cache-partitions
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of partitons to allocate for the triple value index cache. More partitions allow more concurrency, but make each individual cache partition smaller, which could make it more likely for the cache to fill up. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A new value for the number of cache partitions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The server may use fewer or more partitions than the configured value to keep partition sizes between 512 and 12288 megabytes.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-triple-cache-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the timeout value for the triple cache.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-triple-value-cache-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function gets the timeout value for the triple value cache.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-triple-cache-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the timeout value for the triple cache. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The time, in seconds, before a cached page can be flushed to disk.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-triple-value-cache-timeout
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the timeout value for the triple value cache. This is a "cold" operation; when you use admin:save-configuration to save the configuration, it will automatically restart MarkLogic Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The time, in seconds, before a cached page can be flushed to disk.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-using-namespaces
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of any "using" namespaces predefined for the specified App Server. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-module-locations
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of any module locations predefined for the specified App Server. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-add-using-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more "using" namespaces to an App Server configuration, which add the namespaces to the namespace path for all requests evaluated against that App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A sequence of using namespace elements. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-using-namespace().

apidoc:function.name: appserver-delete-using-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Delete one or more "using" namespaces from an App Server configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A sequence of using namespace elements. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-using-namespace().

apidoc:function.name: appserver-add-module-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more module namespace to location mappings to an App Server configuration. The mappings are used to look up a location for an XQuery library module for any request on that App Server when the library module is requested using only the module namespace URI.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A sequence of module location mapping element. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-module-location().

apidoc:function.name: group-get-using-namespaces
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of any "using" namespaces predefined for the specified Group. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-module-locations
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the value of any module locations predefined for the specified Group. If none are defined, returns the empty sequence.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-delete-module-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Delete one or more module location bindings from an App Server configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A sequence of module location mapping element. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-module-location().

apidoc:function.name: group-using-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a using namespace element with the specified URI.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI.

apidoc:function.name: group-module-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a module namespace element with the specified namespace URI and location.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The namespace URI.
The module location.

apidoc:function.name: group-add-using-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more "using" namespaces to a Group configuration, which add the namespaces to the namespace path for all requests evaluated against any App Server in the Group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A sequence of using namespace elements. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-using-namespace().

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-using-namespace
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Delete one or more "using" namespaces from a Group configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A sequence of using namespace elements. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-using-namespace().

apidoc:function.name: group-add-module-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Add one or more module namespace to location mappings to a Group configuration. The mappings are used to look up a location for an XQuery library module for any request on any App Server in that group when the library module is requested using only the module namespace URI.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A sequence of module location mapping element. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-module-location.

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-module-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Delete one or more module location bindings from a Group configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A sequence of module location mapping element. Typically these are the result of calls to admin:group-module-location.

apidoc:function.name: database-tokenizer-override
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a custom tokenizer override. For details, see Custom Tokenization in the Search Developer's Guide.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The character whose tokenization behavior should be overridden.
The new tokenization class for the character. Allowed values are "word", "space", "punctuation", or "symbol".

apidoc:function.name: database-get-field-tokenizer-overrides
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function fetches any custom tokenizer override specifications for the specified field and database. For details, see Custom Tokenization in the Search Developer's Guide.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-field-tokenizer-override
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds tokenizer overrides for the specified field of the specified database. For details, see Custom Tokenization in the Search Developer's Guide.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
The new tokenizer override settings to add to the field.

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-field-tokenizer-override
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the field's tokenizer override in the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
The name of the field.
The tokenizer override specifications, typically the result of an admin:database-tokenizer-override call.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-rebalancer-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the reblanacer enable setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-rebalancer-throttle
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the rebalancer throttle setting for the specified database in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The new setting, which must be a number between 1 and 5 (inclusive). Larger numbers mean to work harder at rebalancing.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-rebalancer-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the rebalancer enable setting for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-rebalancer-throttle
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the rebalancer throttle setting for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: database-set-assignment-policy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the assignment policy for the specified database in the configuration. An assignment policy can be created by either admin:bucket-assignment-policy() or admin:statistical-assignment-policy() or admin:range-assignment-policy($partition-key, $lower-bound-included) or admin:legacy-assignment-policy().

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The assignment policy.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-assignment-policy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the assignment policy for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: legacy-assignment-policy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns an element that represents the legacy assignment policy. Use the admin:database-set-assignment-policy function to set the assignment policy.

apidoc:function.name: bucket-assignment-policy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns an element that represents the bucket assignment policy. Use the admin:database-set-assignment-policy function to set the assignment policy.

apidoc:function.name: statistical-assignment-policy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns an element that represents the statistical assignment policy. Use the admin:database-set-assignment-policy function to set the assignment policy.

apidoc:function.name: database-is-forest-retired
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns fn:true() if the specificed forest is retired and fn:false() the specificed forest is not retired.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: database-is-forest-employed
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns fn:true() if the specificed forest is employed and fn:false() the specificed forest is not employed.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: database-retire-forest
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function "retires" the specified forest in the configuration. To "unretire," or "redeploy" a retired forest, use the admin:database-employ-forest function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: database-employ-forest
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function "employs" the specified forest in the configuration. This function can be used to "unretire" a forest that was previously retired by the admin:database-retire-forest function.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: database-reorder-forests
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function reorders the forests in the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.
The list of forest IDs in the desired order.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-rebalancer-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the rebalancer enable setting for the specified forest from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-rebalancer-enable
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the reblanacer enable setting for the specified forest in the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.
A boolean value, fn:true() to enable, fn:false() to disable.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-retired-forests
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the list of all retired forests for the specified database from the configuration.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database.

apidoc:function.name: range-assignment-policy
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns an element that represents the range assignment policy. Use the admin:database-set-assignment-policy function to set the assignment policy.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: This parameter specifies the cts reference that will be used as the partition key. It can be an element range index, an attribute range index, a field range index or a path range index. The range index can have any data type except for geospatial types.

If this paramenter is fn:true(), ranges on all forests in the database have closed lower bounds and open upper bound; if it is fn:false(), ranges on all forests in the database have open lower bounds and closed upper bounds.
For example, if the partition range is 2011-01-02 (lower) to 2011-01-02 (upper) and lower-bound-include is set to fn:false(), documents with partition key value of 2011-01-02 will not be included in the partition, but documents with a partition key value of 2011-01-03 and 2011-01-02 will be included.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-range-policy-partition-key
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the range policy partition key set for the database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The range assignment policy returned from the admin:database-get-assignment-policy function.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-range-policy-lower-bound
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the lower bound of the range configured on the forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-get-range-policy-upper-bound
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the upper bound of the range configured on the forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-is-range-policy-range-set
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns fn:false() if the specificed forest has neither the lower boundary nor the upper boundary set. Otherwise, it returns fn:true().

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.

apidoc:function.name: forest-set-range-policy-range
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the boundaries of the range on a forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest.
The lower boundary. If it is the empty sequence, the lower boundary is set to be negative infinity.
The upper boundary. If it is the empty sequence, the upper boundary is set to be positive infinity.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-internal-security

The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-external-security
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the external security setting for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-internal-security
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the internal security setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
A boolean value specifying whether the security database is used for authentication and authorization.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-external-security
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the external security setting in the configuration for the specified App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The name of the External Security Config.
A boolean value specifying whether the security database is used for authentication and authorization.
The authentication scheme (basic, digest, digestbasic, application-level, kerberos-ticket, or certificate).

The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: host-set-zone
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function changes the zone value for the host to the newly specified value.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The host ID. Typically, the result of an admin:host-get-id call.
The new name for the zone value.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-metering-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables usage metering for all hosts in the specified group.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A boolean value specifying whether metering is enabled for all hosts in this group.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-meters-database
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function specifies the database to be used to store metering data.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The database ID for the database to set as the meters database.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-performance-metering-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables or disables performance metering for all hosts in the specified group. Performance metering will save data into the meters database which can be used to analyze your system performance over time.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
A boolean value specifying whether performance metering is enabled for all hosts in this group.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-performance-metering-period
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the period (in number of seconds) between when performance data is gathered. setting it to a higher number stores less data but also gives less grainular data; setting it to a lower number stores more data but provides higher grainularity.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The number of seconds between data samples. This value must be 60 or greater, in multiples of 60 (one minute increments).

apidoc:function.name: group-set-performance-metering-retain-raw
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of days of raw performance data to retain.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The number of days worth of raw data to retain.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-performance-metering-retain-hourly
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of days to retain hourly performance data.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The number of hours of data to retain.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-performance-metering-retain-daily
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the number of days of performance metering data to retain.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The number of days of data to retain.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a sub-database to a super-database.

apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup/{id}

apidoc:function.name: database-path-reference
