apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
The path expression for the index. The should path should return true from cts:valid-index-path.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.

apidoc:function.name: database-field-reference
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function creates a db:field-reference specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
The name of the field.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.

apidoc:function.name: database-element-attribute-reference
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function greated a db:element-attribute-reference specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
The namespace URI for the attribute's parent element. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for attribute's parent element.
The namespace URI. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for the node.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.

apidoc:function.name: database-element-reference
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function greated a db:element-reference specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A valid type for the range index. Must be one of: int, unsignedInt, long, unsignedLong, float, double, decimal, dateTime, time, date, gYearMonth, gYear, gMonth, gDay, yearMonthDuration, dayTimeDuration, string, anyURI, or point.
The namespace URI. Specify an empty string if the element is in no namespace.
The local name for the node.
The collation URI (for example, http://marklogic.com/collation/). The collation is only needed for string and anyURI indexes; for other indexes, specify the empty string ("") for this parameter.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-default-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the default amount of memory (in megabytes) that can be used by sem:store for inference.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-default-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function specifies the default value for any request's inference size.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
Amount of memory, in megabytes, allowed for inference.

apidoc:function.name: taskserver-get-default-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the default amount of memory (in megabytes) that can be used by sem:store for inference.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: taskserver-set-default-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function specifies the default value for any request's inference size.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
Amount of memory, in megabytes, allowed for inference.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-max-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the maximum amount of memory in megabytes that can be used by sem:store for inference. The App Server will return an error for queries that exceed this memory limit.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-max-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function specifies the upper bound for any request's inference size. No request may set its inference size higher than this number. The inference size, in turn, is the maximum amount of memory in megabytes allowed for sem:store performing inference. The App Server gives up on queries that exceed the memory limit, and returns an error.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The memory size allowed for inference, in megabytes.

apidoc:function.name: taskserver-get-max-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the maximum amount of memory in megabytes that can be used by sem:store for inference. The task server will return an error for queries that exceed this memory limit.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: taskserver-set-max-inference-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function specifies the upper bound for any request's inference size. No request may set its inference size higher than this number. The inference size, in turn, is the maximum amount of memory in megabytes allowed for sem:store performing inference. The task server gives up on queries that exceed the memory limit, and returns an error.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
Amount of memory, in megabytes, allowed for inference.

apidoc:function.name: database-ruleset
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: The ruleset element (db:default-ruleset) created to be used for inference on a database. One or more rulesets can be used for inference. Rulesets are stored in the Schemas database. By default, no ruleset is configured.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The URI (location) of the ruleset.

apidoc:function.name: database-add-default-ruleset
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function adds a ruleset (db:ruleset) to be used for inference on a database. One or more rulesets can be used for inference. By default, no ruleset is configured.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase"))
The name of one or more rulesets to be used with this database for inference.

apidoc:function.name: database-get-default-rulesets
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the default rulesets for a database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase"))

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-default-ruleset
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the default ruleset used for inference on a database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the database (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase"))
The name of one or more rulesets to be used with this database for inference.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-get-queue-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the queue size for the number of fragments or frames in-flight during database replication.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica or admin:forest-get-foreign-replicas function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage:
During bulk replication, this number would be the number of fragments whose replication is in-flight. For instance, the server will send 10 fragments and wait for the first one to be acknowledged before sending the 11th fragment.
During normal operation, this number applies to journal frames rather than fragments. The server will stop sending new frames once it has 10 unacknowledged frames. It will stop sending frames until it gets an acknowledgement for the oldest one.

apidoc:function.name: database-foreign-replica-set-queue-size
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the queue size for the number of fragments or frames in-flight during database replication.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: The element returned by the admin:forest-foreign-replica or admin:forest-get-foreign-replicas function that specifies the configuration for the replica forest.

The number of fragments or frames in the queue. During bulk replication, this number would be the number of fragments whose replication is in-flight. For instance, the server will send 10 fragments and wait for the first one to be acknowledged before sending the 11th fragment.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: During normal operation, this queue size applies to journal frames rather than fragments. The server will stop sending new frames once it has 10 unacknowledged frames. It will stop sending frames until it gets an acknowledgement for the oldest one.

apidoc:function.name: database-backup-get-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true or false to indicate whether a specific backup is enabled for a database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID for the database (for example, xdmp:database ("myDatabase")).
The ID of the backup, found by XPath to the backup location (for example, //db:backup-id/).

apidoc:function.name: database-backup-set-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables database backup for the specified database.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID for the database (for example, xdmp:database ("myDatabase")).
The ID of the backup, found by XPath to the backup location(for example, //db:backup-id/).
Sets the database backup to enabled. The default is true, which means the database backup will take place.

apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup/{id}

apidoc:function.name: database-delete-backup-by-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes a specific database backup, identified by the backup ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID for the database (for example, xdmp:database ("myDatabase")).

apidoc:function.apidoc:privilege:
This operation requires at least one of the following privileges:
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup
http://marklogic.com/xdmp/privileges/admin/database/backup/{id}

apidoc:function.name: forest-backup-get-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true or false to indicate whether backup is enabled for the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The ID of the backup.

apidoc:function.name: forest-backup-set-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables forest backup for the specified forest.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".
The ID of the backup, found by XPath to the backup location (for example, //fa:backup-id/).
Enables forest backup. The default is true, which means the forest backup will occur.

apidoc:function.name: forest-delete-backup-by-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the forest backup specified by the forest ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the forest. For example, xdmp:forest("myForest") specifies the ID for a forest named "myForest".

apidoc:function.name: group-get-scheduled-task
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns information about a scheduled task for a group based on the task ID and the group ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The ID of the task.

apidoc:function.name: group-scheduled-task-set-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function enables one or more scheduled tasks for a group based on the group ID and task ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The ID of the task, the result of an admin:group-get-scheduled-task call.
Enables group scheduled task to occur. The default is true, which means the scheduled group task will occur.

apidoc:function.name: group-scheduled-task-get-enabled
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns true or false to indicate whether a scheduled task for a group is enabled.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The ID of the task, the result of an admin:group-get-scheduled-task call.

apidoc:function.name: group-delete-scheduled-task-by-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function deletes the scheduled tasks for a group using the group ID.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group to which the App Server belongs. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The ID or IDs of the tasks to be deleted.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-default-error-format
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the default format for protocol errors for an App Server. The 'default' error format can be compatible, json, html, or xml. At runtime the actual error format is resolved to a concrete formatba sed on many factors, and will end up as JSON, HTML, or XML.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-default-error-format
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the default format protocol errors for an App Server. The 'default' error format can be compatible, json, html, or xml. At runtime the actual error format is resolved to a concrete format based on many factors, and will end up as JSON, HTML, or XML.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The format for the protocol error. The format can be compatible, json, html, or xml.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-get-coordinate-system
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Get the default coordinate system for an App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: appserver-set-coordinate-system
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: Set the default geospatial coordinate system for an App Server.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the App Server. Typically, this is the result of an admin:appserver-get-id call.
The canonical name of a supported geospatial coordinate system, such as wgs84/double, etrs89, etrs89/double, raw, or raw/double.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The name of the coordinate system also specifies the default point coordinate value precision. For example, "wgs84" implicitly specifies single precision, while "wgs84/double" specifies double precision. You can generate the canonical name for a coordinate system/precision combination using geo:coordinate-system-canonicalgeo.coordinateSystemCanonical.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-data-encryption-key-id
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the encryption key ID to use for encryption of data.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

An string identifying the encryption key at the KMS that should be used to encrypt user data. The string must be a URN representation of a UUID as defined by RFC4122: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt Example URN: 06ea22c9-b972-4652-8d0f-9e58c62e0f7f

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the encryption key ID used for encryption of data.

The ID of the database to copy (for example, xdmp:database("myDatabase")).
Specifies the encryption setting for the database identified by database-id. Valid values are: default-cluster, on, and off.

Parameter description...

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-keystore-kms-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the type of Keystore Management System (KMS) to be used. By default it is set to internal KMS, if configuring an external KMS, a KSM host name and port number must also be set. See admin:cluster-set-keystore-host-name, and admin:cluster-cluster-set-keystore-port

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
Specifies the type of the KMS valid values are: internal, and external

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-keystore-kms-type
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the encryption setting at cluster level for log files

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-telemetry-log-level
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the initial log level for telemetry, which is also the maximum (finest) log level that will be sent.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The maximum (finest) log level at which telemetry will collect and forward logs. This must be either "disabled" or one of the levels defined in admin:group-set-file-log-level() (must be one of finest, finer, fine, debug, config, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency).
If set to "disabled" then no log file data will be collected or sent to telemetry.
Note: The logfile data collected by telemetry is unaffected by other log level settings such as admin:group-set-log-level().
For example you may configure telemetry to send "fine" log file data to assist in a support case, while only collecting "info" level in the Logs directory.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-telemetry-log-level
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary:
This function returns the current configured telemetry log level.
Note: The current effective log level may be lower than this if limited by the Secure Telemetry Storage service.
No host will send logs finer than the configured level.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-telemetry-config
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the update frequency for configuation changes sent to telemetry, would also be the maximum frequency at which updates will be sent.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The frequency at which configuration file updates will be sent to the Secure Telemetry Storage.
This must be one of "disabled","frequent","infrequent".
If "frequent", then all configuration changes will be sent.
If "infrequent" then only periodic snapshots will be sent.
If "disabled" then no configuration files are sent.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-telemetry-config
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the currently set frequency for sending configuration file changes to telemetry.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-telemetry-metering
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the level of metering data sent to telemetry. This is also the maximum level of information that will be sent.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

The maximum level of detail for metering data updates sent to the Secure Telemetry Storage.
Must be one of "disabled","raw","hourly","daily". These correspond to data collected by metering. Raw data is collected according to the period set by admin:group-set-performance-metering-period() and includes Hourly and Data aggregates. Hourly metering data is collected hourly and includes Daily data. Daily metering data is collected daily.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-telemetry-metering
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the configured detail level for collecting metering data sent to telemetry.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: group-set-telemetry-session-endpoint
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the initial session endpoint for telemetry.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.
The session endpoint for telemetry. The default setting should not be changed unless directed by Support to do so.

apidoc:function.name: group-get-telemetry-session-endpoint
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the initial default telemetry endpoint.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The ID of the group. Typically, this is the result of an admin:group-get-id call.

apidoc:function.name: database-metadata-field
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function constructs a metadata field specification.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: Name of the field.

apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function rotates the encryption key ID to use for encryption of configuration files when MarkLogic is configured with internal KMS

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-keystore-p11-driver-path
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This set the PKCS#11 library used to access the MLWallet. By default we use SoftHSM as key storage. A customer wanting to configure MarkLogic with an 3rd party HSM needs to update the path to the PKCS#11 library using this API. Note switching the HSM requires that the HSM be uninitialized at slot 0 without a PIN preset. MarkLogic will set the PIN and initialize slot 0.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
A host fully qualified path to the PKCS#11 library

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-keystore-p11-driver-path
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the current setting for the PKCS#11 library path

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-keystore-passphrase
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function resets the MarkLogic PKCS#11 wallet protection passphrase

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The current passphrase used to protect the embedded KMS
The new passphrase to be used to protect the embedded KMS

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-keystore-logs-encryption-passphrase
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: MarkLogic supports encrypting the logs with a secondary encryption passphrase, this function can be used to set the passphrase. Note that log encryption must be enabled for this passphrase to be used.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
A passphrase to use when encrypting the logs

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-keystore-wallet-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function is used to set the PKCS#11 wallet location.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The directory location where the embedded PKCS#11 wallet will be saved.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-keystore-backup-option
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function is used to set the backup option for the embedded PKCS#11 wallet.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

The backup option to use. Valid values are: include and exclude By default the embedded KMS (PKCS#11 wallet) is automatically included in backups. Setting the option to exclude will prevent the embedded KMS from being included in the backups.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-keystore-wallet-location
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the PKCS#11 wallet location if it has been set by cluster-set-keystore-wallet-location.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-keystore-backup-option
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function is used to get the backup option for the embedded PKCS#11 wallet.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-opsdirector-log-level
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets Ops Director log level of the managed cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The logging level: "emergency", "alert", "critical", "error", "warning", "notice", etc.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-opsdirector-config
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the frequency with which the managed cluster sends configuration changes to Ops Director.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
Correct operation of Ops Director requires that the frequency be set to "frequent".

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-opsdirector-metering
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the type of metering data the managed cluster sends to Ops Director.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The metering type: "disabled", "daily", "hourly", or "raw".

apidoc:function.name: cluster-set-opsdirector-session-endpoint
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function sets the session endpoint URI that the managed cluster uses to communicate with Ops Director.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
The endpoint URI.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-opsdirector-log-level
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the current Ops Director log level of the managed cluster.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The return value is the logging level, with possible values "emergency", "alert", "critical", "error", "warning", "notice", etc.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-opsdirector-config
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the current frequency with which the managed cluster sends configuration changes to Ops Director.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-opsdirector-metering
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the current type of metering data the managed cluster sends to Ops Director.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.

apidoc:function.apidoc:usage: The return value is the metering type, with possible values "disabled", "daily", "hourly", or "raw".

apidoc:function.name: cluster-get-opsdirector-session-endpoint
apidoc:function.apidoc:summary: This function returns the session endpoint URI that the managed cluster uses to communicate with Ops Director.

apidoc:params.apidoc:param: A configuration specification, typically as returned from one of the Admin module functions.
